node.text:
The time to start thinking about the next pandemic is now. And there’s a bigger threat on the horizon much worse than what we’ve experienced with COVID-19. ⁣Antibiotic resistance. 💊

In 1945, Alexander Fleming, who discovered penicillin, warned of the danger of over-reliance on antibiotics and the threat of bacteria developing resistance. Before antibiotics, even a small scratch could be fatal. Giving birth and having surgery were a lot riskier and sexually transmitted infections could be a death sentence. 💀

Antibiotic use in livestock now outweighs human consumption - some 80% of all antibiotics are used as growth supplements and to control infection in animals. 🐖

The World Health Organisation says that antimicrobial resistance is one of the main threats to modern medicine, with growing numbers of infections, such as pneumonia, tuberculosis, gonorrhoea and salmonellosis, becoming harder to treat. 🏥🚑

node.title: The Next Pandemic Explained - In 4 Minutes ⏰🦠

node.text:
Much like the climate crisis, the plastic problem that exist today on Earth, seems gargantuan in nature. Humanity has created these problems, and it is humanity that will find a solution to them.

Plastic now pervades every part of our lives. It is in our food, our water, and it even falls from the sky in some parts of the world in the form of micro plastics.

Plastic has even reached the deepest trenches of the oceans of Earth. 🌊🌎

Some say that by 2050, there will be more plastic in the ocean and there will be fish. 🐟

So what can we do about it?

⭐️ Stop eating fish, 46% of ocean plastics are discarded fishing nets. 
⭐️ Recycle
⭐️ Upcycle
⭐️ Reuse
⭐️ Petition your local political leaders to ban single use plastic items.
⭐️ Education is key
⭐️ Volunteer for beach clean ups

What are your tips for reducing your plastic use?

Video featuring @joshwideawake and @robbie_lockie

node.text:
Today is International Orangutan Day. 🦧 One of our closest relatives on Earth is being pushed to the brink of extinction, just so we can enjoy our favorite products.

This banned TV AD from UK Supermarket Iceland (@icelandfoods), made by @greenpeace illustrates the reality of palm oil farming.

Orangutans have declined by around 50% in the last 60 years and today they’re only found on two islands – Sumatra and Borneo. Despite once roaming as far north as southern China, and as far south as the Indonesian island of Java.

Illegal logging, mining, hunting and the pet trade are all very serious issues for the remaining populations of Orangutan. However the biggest cause of habitat loss and therefore the decline in Orangutan numbers is palm oil. Palm oil is found in around 50% of items in your supermarket.

Where you can, avoid products containing UNSUSTAINABLE palm oil, and instead, opt for Sustainable Palm Oil (RSPO) - as this is the most efficient oil we can forest. If we all switched to other oils deforestation would INCREASE, so opt for sustainable palm oil where possible.

node.text:
Join me @robbie_lockie for this live Q&A with Jen Stojkovic founder of @veganwomensummit 

Vegan Women Summit™ (VWS) is a global events and media organization created to empower female-identifying change makers to bring compassion to their careers. VWS hosts events with the goal to foster a community of strong, ambitious rising leaders working to build a kinder, more sustainable world. VWS is supported by leading CEOs, venture capitalists, artists, athletes, & nonprofit leaders from around the world.

VWS strives to provide an inclusive environment for all and defines “women” and “female” as including all individuals who identify, have identified, or have been identified as women or female. Attendees of all backgrounds, including all genders, are invited to participate in VWS events. 

Find out more at https://veganwomensummit.com

node.text:
@madeinhackney Made In Hackney opened its doors in 2012 as the UK’s first fully vegan community cookery school and charity.

They collaborate with communities to showcase and develop skills, knowledge and inspiration to grow, cook and eat more plants.

The kitchen started as a response to global and local crisis – health inequalities, food access and climate change. These interconnected issues drive their mission to bring about positive change in the areas of community, health and environment with delicious, culturally varied, nutritious plant-based food at the centre of all they do.

The heartbeat of their organisation is their cookery and food growing classes. These sessions are opportunities to come together, share skills and cultural cuisines, learn new ones, deepen community connection and inspire joyful and lasting behaviour change. The results of these gatherings are beautiful.

From curing type 2 diabetes, healing chronic bowel disorders, improving chronic fatigue symptoms, helping to manage depression, forming new friendships, starting a window ledge garden, gaining the skills and confidence to start a food business or learning to cook for the first time age 82 – the MIH family members unique journey’s after participating in their programmes never cease to amaze and inspire.

Find out more at https://madeinhackney.org/

node.text:
⚠️ Video contains graphic footage ⚠️

Whaling has taken place in the Faroe Islands for the past 1,000 years.

Every year, an annual hunt known as ‘the grind’ takes place between June - September at any one of the 26 designated killing bays around the islands.

On June 27th, @seashepherd crew witnessed 175 pilot whales be brutally killed in the name of this barbaric tradition. The dead included juveniles and pregnant females, who’s almost fully formed foetuses were discarded as trash.

Visit plnt.news/faroeislands (link in stories) to read more on this topic, or visit @seashepherd to find out how you can help put an end to it.

node.text:
Since @gretathunberg first appeared on the world’s stage, she has sounded the alarm over what will make Covid-19 look like a walk in the park. Climate breakdown is happening NOW.

People are not only quick to put Greta down, but speak of her in such unjustified and unforgivable ways.

Some of the following are examples of the narratives people believe;

✅ Greta is being controlled by the media
✅ Greta doesn’t write her own scripts and is a puppet
✅ George Soros made her
✅ Greta is a child and can’t possibly be thinking for herself

And then there are all the sexist, hateful, misogynistic commentary which we can not repeat. Most of these born out of a toxic sexist narrative from a society that can not understand how a young woman could be so intelligent. Greta is 18 years old. She is an adult.

If Greta was male, she wouldn’t receive a fraction of the hate she gets today. Society  pretends to be equal in how men and woman are treated, but that is simply not true. An illusion built and upheld by our patriarchal society. Women have been undermined, railroaded, gaslight, raped, abused, under-funded, under represented for centuries.

Greta’s message is one of extreme urgency, we are living on borrowed time. Our leaders have failed us. They need to start listening.

Or we are all f*cked.

Words by @robbie_lockie

node.title: Speaking Truth To Power Takes Guts

node.text:
🔊SOUND ON 🔊
We are in the midst of an environmental emergency. Our forests are burning, our air is being polluted, our oceans are being poisoned, our soil degraded, and our wildlife wiped out. Never before in human history have we seen ecological devastation on this scale.  If we don’t act soon there won’t be a future to fight for.

Animal farming is at the heart of the climate crisis. Animal products provide just 18 per cent of calories while taking up 83 per cent of all farmland and produces 60 per cent of agriculture’s greenhouse gas emissions. We could reduce the use of farmland by over 75 per cent if we adopted a vegan diet. In 2018, the most comprehensive analysis of agriculture ever conducted, led by the University of Oxford, found overwhelmingly that the ‘single biggest way’ that individuals can protect the planet and our future is to adopt a vegan lifestyle.

The impact of eating animal products reaches far beyond the cow that you’re eating. It is contributing to the world’s sixth mass extinction and hurtling us towards a catastrophic temperature rise of up to 5°C by the end of this century.

Time is running out. Runaway climate change and habitat destruction have become THE most profound challenges of our age. We still have time left before we pass the point of no-return if we ACT NOW.

Going vegan is the single biggest thing you can do to cut down your environmental impact. Start your journey today.

Search Google for “Vegan Now” or follow @vivacharity to find out more.

node.text:
Our food system is collapsing around us, and some farming practices are destroying the precious soil we have left. It’s time to start focusing on solutions. 🌱

Watch @rosariodawson’s award-winning film, @theneedtogrow for free via this link 👉 plnt.news/needtogrow (clickable in IGTV) or swipe up on our stories!

node.text:
Dr Gemma Newman is a sparkling light in the medical field. She speaks from a point of knowledge and wisdom as well as making it easy to digest. The Plant Power Doctor is packed full of leading science in a very accessible way and lots of beautiful recipes too. -- David Flynn and Stephen Flynn The Happy Pear

Dr Gemma is delightful and whip-smart. May you be equal parts entertained and enlightened by her welcoming presence. -- Rich Roll

Dr Gemma is one of the few brave voices in the medical community who is experienced, courageous and confident enough to talk openly about food and its significance in preventing disease to save lives. What you choose to put on your plate is one of the most important health interventions and more plants is certainly the message we all need to hear. This book is a fantastic resource for people looking to improve their wellbeing and I'm personally inspired by Gemma's resilience and effort. -- Dr Rupy Aujla (Bestselling author and founder of The Doctor's Kitchen)

A must read for everyone. Food really can be medicine and Gemma shows you how. -- Dr Shireen Kassam (Consultant Haematologist, Founder of Plant Based Health Professionals UK)

Plant Power Doctor lays the foundation for a lifetime of good health and happiness - for both your mind and body. -- Rohini Bajekal (Nutritionist and Board-
Certified Lifestyle Medicine Professional)

An accessible resource, and one that is overflowing with practical, life-saving information. -- Brenda Davis (Research Dietitian)

Dr Newman is one of the few doctors who truly understands how to keep people healthy - instead of just treating them when they're sick. Her terrific Plant Power Doctor should be on the bookshelves of everyone who wants to live a longer, better life. -- Dan Buettner (New York Times Bestselling author of The Blue Zones)

Knowledge is power and so are plant-based foods! Thanks for making it so easy to understand. -- Derek Sarno (Wicked Kitchen co-founder and author)
One of a new wave of GPs who prescribe lifestyle changes as well as drugs. * The Telegraph *

node.title: The Plant Power Doctor - Dr Gemma Newman

node.text:
The time to start thinking about the next pandemic is now. And there’s a bigger threat on the horizon much worse than what we’ve experienced with COVID-19. ⁣Antibiotic resistance. 💊

In 1945, Alexander Fleming, who discovered penicillin, warned of the danger of over-reliance on antibiotics and the threat of bacteria developing resistance. Before antibiotics, even a small scratch could be fatal. Giving birth and having surgery were a lot riskier and sexually transmitted infections could be a death sentence. 💀

Antibiotic use in livestock now outweighs human consumption - some 80% of all antibiotics are used as growth supplements and to control infection in animals. 🐖

The World Health Organisation says that antimicrobial resistance is one of the main threats to modern medicine, with growing numbers of infections, such as pneumonia, tuberculosis, gonorrhoea and salmonellosis, becoming harder to treat. 🏥🚑

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Plant Based News on September 03, 2021. May be an image of animal and text that says 'Mexico Becomes First Country In North America Το Ban Animal Testing For Cosmetics PBN'.

node.text:
Mexico is now the first country in North America – and the 41st country worldwide – to outlaw animal testing for cosmetics.⠀
⠀
The federal bill won the unanimous support of Mexico’s Senate.⠀
⠀
The bill was largely championed by the Humane Society International @hsiglobal and ONG Te Protejo @teprotejo, thanks to their multi-year campaign. ⠀
⠀
“We are thrilled to see Mexico become the first country in North America to outlaw cosmetic animal testing, and commend our bill sponsor Senator Ricardo Monreal, and all congressmen and women for voting to end cosmetic animal testing in Mexico,” the two organizations said in a joint statement.⠀
⠀
The law also bans the import, manufacture, and marketing of cosmetics that have been tested on animals anywhere in the world. ⠀
⠀
Read more via the link in our bio.⠀
⠀
https://plantbasednews.org/culture/ethics/mexico-ban-animal-testing/

node.text:
“This is what vegans can do!” 🤣

9 year vegan strongman @patrikbaboumian showing @piersmorgan just how strong he is! 😅

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Plant Based News on September 02, 2021. May be an image of 1 person, food and text that says 'PBN KFC KFC Unveils New Vegan IKFC Chicken, And 5 Other New Vegan Food Launches 10LO'.

node.text:
Fast-food giant KFC Thailand is adding vegan chicken to its menus, in a move to expand the brand’s plant-based offerings.⠀
⠀
Made with CP Foods’ vegan chicken, the meat alternative is dubbed to have the same taste as KFC’s original items. Moreover, it will feature the same signature seasoning.⠀
⠀
In other plant-based food news:⠀
⠀
🧀 Artisan vegan cheese launches in Hong Kong (@lataulaofficial)
⠀
🍫 Confectionary giant Mars expands Galaxy vegan range (@galaxyuk)
⠀
🥕 Scottish soup brand Baxters launches new vegan soups (@baxters_uk)
⠀
🌱🍖 Plant-based meat brand expands range in U.S Sprouts stores (@hungryplanetfoods)
⠀
🌱 Franklin Farms adds to its range of Chickpea Tofu products (@franklinfarmsfoods)
⠀
Read the full roundup via the link in our bio⠀
⠀
https://plantbasednews.org/lifestyle/food/kfc-vegan-chicken-food-launches/

This is New York City right now 🏙. As the city is hit with the remnants of hurricane Ida, it is a stark reminder that no one is safe from the damaging effects of the freak weather that climate change brings.  
Hurricanes are caused by multiple factors - but the climate crisis makes extreme weather events more likely, more frequent, and more severe. Animal agriculture is a leading cause of deforestation, biodiversity loss, land and water degradation, pollution, and huge increases in greenhouse gas emissions. 🏭 💨 

All of these factors accelerate the climate crisis 🔥 🌊 

In 2019, the world’s most comprehensive analysis of farming’s impact on the planet, from The University Of Oxford, found that a vegan diet is ‘the single biggest way to reduce your impact on planet Earth’. 🌱

Try vegan with 👉 @weareveganuary 

(Video sources via Twitter; maps_dk, theinsiderpaper)

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Plant Based News on September 01, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'PBN TOFU Never Pandemic! Caused A Try it today! @plantbasednews'.

node.text:
Today is International #TofuDay ! 😅 Tofu never caused a pandemic, tofu just wants to be eaten and nourish us with plant-based protein! 🤣 ⠀ ⁣⠀⠀
⠀
Did you know that 3 in 4 of the world’s new or emerging infectious diseases come from animals. Responsible for nearly 3 million deaths a year, these diseases are largely transmitted through trading wildlife (legally and illegally) and factory farming.⁣ COVID-19 is one of many zoonotic diseases including SARS, MERS, Ebola and HIV – all of which came from animals, and new viruses are appearing with increasing frequency. This pandemic is the worst we have seen for generations, but is a warning of things to come.⠀ ⠀⠀
⠀
As we continue to encroach on wildlife and expand factory farming, the threat of more pandemics increases.⁣⠀
⠀
Soy has been given a bad name for decades with myths citing it as being full of hormones, and capable of affecting both estrogen and testosterone.... However this is not true. Thanks to a leading meta-analysis study, the verdict is in: you shouldn’t fear soy! Find out why via the link in our bio!⠀
⠀
https://plantbasednews.org/lifestyle/health/soy-hormone-meta-analysis/

node.text:
Celebrate International #TofuDay with this amazing homemade tofu from 👉 @sovegan 😮

For more easy recipes like this follow 👉 @pbnfood 

Full recipe below 👇

🌿 3 cups dried soya beans (550g / 19.5oz)
🌿 4 tbsp lemon juice

1️⃣ Add the soya beans to a large mixing bowl and cover with water almost to the top of the bowl. Leave to soak for 6 hours or overnight

2️⃣ Drain the soya beans and rinse under water. Next blend the soaked beans in 3 litres / 101 fl.oz of water (we usually do this in 3 batches). Then transfer the milk to a nut bag over a large mixing bowl. Squeeze the bag to extract the milk into the mixing bowl. This can take up to 10 mins or until the pulp inside the bag is mostly dry

3️⃣ Transfer the soy milk to a large saucepan over a low-medium heat. Bring the milk to a gentle simmer and cook for 15 minutes, stirring regularly. Use a skimmer or a fine sieve to remove any foam or skin that collects on the surface

4️⃣ Meanwhile combine the lemon juice with 200ml / 6.8 fl.oz of water. After the soy milk has finished simmering, remove from the heat and leave for a couple of minutes to settle. Then stir in roughly a third of the diluted lemon juice. Stir in the remaining diluted lemon juice in two more batches and keep stirring until the soy milk curdles. If the milk doesn’t curdle, add it back to a low heat until the curds form

5️⃣ Use a skimmer or fine sieve to transfer the curds to your chosen press. Then press for a minimum of 15 mins or longer depending on how firm you like your tofu

6️⃣ You can eat the tofu immediately. Alternatively add the tofu to an airtight container and submerge it in water where it will last for up to 5 days in the fridge

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Plant Based News on September 01, 2021. May be an image of 2 people, people standing, bicycle, outdoors and text.

node.text:
A father of four says adopting a plant-based diet has helped him lose 14 stone (nearly 89kg) and reverse multiple health conditions.⠀
⠀
Mark Henderson (@theveganmooncat) made the move after suffering from a severe cardiac event. “Doctors were not sure I would survive,” he told Plant Based News. “They also said after this event I would probably die from the next event, due to my body being at the limits of what it could cope with.”⠀
⠀
Henderson had been overweight for most of his life, reaching around 34 stone, he said.⠀
⠀
“I had multiple chronic conditions including a heart arrhythmia, sleep apnoea, venous insufficiency, pre-diabetes, severe joint pain, and psoriasis that covered around 60 percent of my skin,” the 48 year old explained.⠀
⠀
The health scare motivated Henderson to look closer at the link between diet and disease. He ultimately decided to adopt a whole-food plant-based diet.⠀
⠀
Read more about Mark's health transformation via the link in our bio.⠀
⠀
https://plantbasednews.org/your-health/transformations/man-vegan-reverses-multiple-health-conditions/

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Plant Based News on August 31, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says '"We're taught as children milk comes from cows when in reality, milk comes from mothers" Preacher Lawson Comedian PBN'.

node.text:
Not your mom, not your milk 👀 🥛⠀
⠀
Check out our latest podcast with legendary vegan advocate and comedian @preacherlawson by tapping the link in our bio! ⠀
⠀
PBN Co-founder @robbie_lockie had a great discussion about Preacher's vegan journey and how he brings comedy into his activism.⠀
⠀
Preacher is best known for being a finalist on the 12th season of America's Got Talent. He returned for America's Got Talent: The Champions, where he finished in 5th place.⠀
⠀
Preacher started writing jokes when he was 16 for about a year, then performed for the first time at the age of 17. He won the 2015 Funniest Comedian In Florida and the 2016 Seattle International Comedy Competition.⠀
⠀
http://plnt.news/pod65

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Plant Based News on August 31, 2021. May be an image of outdoors and text that says 'PBN BREAKING 'World's Most Famous' Alpaca Killed By Government After Losing 4-Year Legal Battle'.

node.text:
An alpaca named Geronimo has been slaughtered after a lengthy legal battle between his owner and the Department of Food, Environment and Rural Affairs (Defra).⠀
⠀
Defra announced that the 8-year-old alpaca must be euthanized after he tested positive for bovine tuberculosis twice in 2017. ⠀
⠀
Members of Defra and the police force arrived at the farm today to take the animal away to be killed. Protestors watched alongside Macdonald, who told the BBC she had not received a warning in advance .⠀
⠀
“I am absolutely disgusted by this government. These are barbaric actions. It’s a disgrace,” Macdonald said to the BBC.

Read more via the link in our bio.

https://plantbasednews.org/culture/ethics/alpaca-killed-government-legal-battle/

node.text:
A recent study published in the British Medical Journal found that plant-based dieters were 73% less likely to develop moderate to severe COVID-19. 😷

Conversely, those eating a high protein, low-carb diet with meat were almost four times more likely to develop moderate to severe COVID-19 compared to the plant-based dieters.

Tofu has never caused a pandemic! Try a plant-based diet today with 👉 @weareveganuary 

📚 Source: British Medical Journal

https://nutrition.bmj.com/content/early/2021/05/18/bmjnph-2021-000272
